overview:
Sean O’Brien is an entrepreneur and consultant who has co-founded numerous startups and provided marketing guidance for SMBs to Fortune 100s.

Sean graduated summa cum laude from Ohio University as the Salutatorian of the nationally ranked College of Business; double majoring in finance and economics with a minor in management information systems (MIS).

In 2003 Sean co-founded Columbus Web Design using $15K in seed money. In the first year of operations, the company grossed well into six-figures and landed notable clients such as Ohio Governor John Kasich, national franchises, and contestants from Donald Trump’s The Apprentice on NBC. Columbus Web Design was acquired by Distant Horizon Inc. in 2005.

Later in 2005 Sean co-founded CanopyChair.com and by 2007 was featured in a cover story for Entrepreneur for his success in marketing the patented “Original Canopy Chair” co-invented by Paul Robinette and Dave Reeb. According to the article, CanopyChair.com had anticipated revenues of $10 million for 2007. In June 2007, the patented technology and retail distribution rights were sold to Swimways Corporation, and the chair can now be found at Walmart, Sam’s Club, Target, REI, Sears, Kmart, and many other big box retailers under their subsidiary brand Kelsyus.

In 2007 Sean became director of e-commerce for WorkGear.com, one of the largest sellers of work clothing and footwear online, and currently holds this position.

In the summer of 2010, as an advisor to DivotCard, Sean was featured in a two-page photo spread for the “Elevator Pitch” column of Inc.’s special July/August double issue. The column featured the company’s elevator pitch to raise $1MM and they subsequently received numerous offers. DivotCard currently has a presence in several Midwestern cities, and Sean continues his role as advisor to the firm in the areas of raising capital and marketing.

As an independent consultant, Sean has provided online marketing guidance for household names including Procter & Gamble (Swiffer, Febreze, Dawn, Mr. Clean, Cascade, Prilosec OTC, Crest), Novartis (AlzheimersDisease.com, Exelon, Tobi), GlaxoSmithKline (Tykerb, Treximet), RadioShack, and Allergan (Lap-Band).
